abstract: Editorial urges the federal government to review evidence from 2001 case in which anthrax-laced letters killed five people, noting that recent scientific analysis casts doubt on guilt of Army biodefense expert Dr Bruce Ivins, who committed suicide before his trial; asserts that if evidence does not hold up, Congress should commission an independent assessment to ensure the culprits are not still at large.
snippet: New research raises doubts that investigators found the perpetrator. Congress should commission an independent assessment to be sure there are no culprits still at large.
